headline.main: MORE ABOUT THE FIGHT AT SANTA ROSA.; MILITARY AND NAVAL INTELLIGENCE.

headline.main: OUR PORT ROYAL CORRESPONDENCE.; The Change Produced After the Landing of the National Troops Capabilities of the Harbor A Regular Line of Steamers to Run to New-York Stores of Cotton The Influx of Contrabands Effects of the Blow upon South Caralina, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: This place has now been in the hands of the Federal forces for three days, and although only the troops are landed, the change produced is remarkable. In the first hurry and confusion, amid which I wrote an account of the events of Thursday, I had no opportunity to do more than note the more salient of those events and the merest outside of circumstances.

docs.snippet: The arrival of the steamship Constitution at the modern Athens has been an event of no little interest to the good people of this city. The arrangements of the Long Wharf Company were promptly made to accommodate the ship, whose guards were too high...

headline.main: THE EXPEDITION FROM BOSTON.; VISITORS THRONGING TO THE SHIP VISIT OF THE MAYOR AND CITY COUNCIL THEIR OPINION OF THE SHIP ARRANGEMENTS FOR RECEIVING THE TROOPS AT BOSTON AND PORTLAND.

docs.lead_paragraph: The arrival of the steamship Constitution at the modern Athens has been an event of no little interest to the good people of this city. The arrangements of the Long Wharf Company were promptly made to accommodate the ship, whose guards were too high to permit her to lie safety at the pier at high tide, and long piles wore driven down to keep her from overlapping it.

docs.snippet: By the arrival of the steamship Columbia, we have advices from Havana to Nov. 15.

headline.main: News from Havana.; ARRIVAL OF THE STEAMSHIP COLUMBIA.

docs.lead_paragraph: By the arrival of the steamship Columbia, we have advices from Havana to Nov. 15.

docs.snippet: The United States steamer Rhode Island, S.D. TRENCHARD, Commander, from Ship Island 5th Nov., Southwest Pass 7th, Key West 10th, Savannah and Charleston 14th, Port Royal 16th, Wilmington, N.C., 17TH, Fortress Monroe 18th, arrived here yesterday...

headline.main: NEWS FROM THE GULF PORTS.; AFFAIRS GENERALLY UNCHANGED. Particulars of the Second Attempt to Surprise Wilson's Zouaves.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States steamer Rhode Island, S.D. TRENCHARD, Commander, from Ship Island 5th Nov., Southwest Pass 7th, Key West 10th, Savannah and Charleston 14th, Port Royal 16th, Wilmington, N.C., 17TH, Fortress Monroe 18th, arrived here yesterday afternoon. On the 9th inst., off Key West, spoke the Underwriters' schooner, Henry W. Johnson, bound to the Hole in the Wall, in search of a reported privateer.

headline.main: THE GREAT REBELLION.; IMPORTANT NEWS FROM WASHINGTON. Particulars of the Attack Upon the Brooklyn Fourteenth. Another Speech by Secretary Cameron. His Faith in the Ability of the Government to Crush the Rebellion. LATE INTELLIGENCE FROM PORT ROYAL. Beaufort Not Yet Occupied by the National Troops. Interesting Details of the Condition of Affairs There. THE FLEET NOT YET GONE SOUTH. Success of the Expedition to the Eastern Shore of Virginia. Gen. Butler's Division Embarking at Boston. SPECIAL DISPATCH FROM WASHINGTON. A RECEPTION TO PRENTICE. SECRETARY CAMERON'S REMARKS. MR. PRENTICE'S REMARKS. RELATIVE TO SEIZURES OF VESSELS. THE OATH NOT TO BEAR ARMS. REBEL PRISONERS RELEASED. A LETTER FROM COL. LEE. A MOVEMENT OF THE REBELS. THE GRAND REVIEW. THE CASE OF MR. DULIN. MEN OF THE THIRTIETH NEW-YORK CAPTURED. COMMANDER OF THE MISSISSIPPI FLEET. CHIEF ENGINEER OF STAFF. THE CASE OF COMMANDER POORE. COMMISSARY APPOINTED. APPOINTED A LIEUTENANT. THE FRAUDS OF A COMMISSARY. COL. WARD H. LAMON. SLIDELL A LAND-OWNER IN MINNESOTA. BUIL

docs.lead_paragraph: This evening, a reception was given by Col. JOHN W. FORNEY, at his residence, to GEORGE D. PRENTICE, of the Louisville Journal. A numerous assemblage of distinguished citizens was present, among whom were Secretaries Cameron and Smith, Assistant Postmaster-General Kasson, Assistant Attorney-General Coffey, Senators Wilkinson, McDougal, Trumbull and Pomeroy; Adjt.-Gen. Thomas; Gens. Porter and Sykes; Hon. Robert J. Walker, Prof. Bache, Hon. Thos. H. Clay and many others.

docs.snippet: The steamship United Kingdom, from Glasgow on the 9th inst., for New-York, arrived off Cape Race at 4 o'clock this (Tuesday) morning. She was boarded by the news-yacht of the Associated Press and a summary of her news obtained.

headline.main: ONE DAY LATER FROM EUROPE.; The United Kingdom off Cape Race. POLITICAL NEWS UNIMPORTANT The Liverpool Cotton Market Unchanged.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship United Kingdom, from Glasgow on the 9th inst., for New-York, arrived off Cape Race at 4 o'clock this (Tuesday) morning. She was boarded by the news-yacht of the Associated Press and a summary of her news obtained.

headline.main: An Extraordinary Speech Gen. Patterson and Gen. Scott.

docs.lead_paragraph: We published, yesterday, a brief report of a speech made in Philadelphia on Saturday last, by Gen. PATTERSON, avowedly in reply to the criticisms that have been passed upon his failure to detain Gen. JOHNSTON in the valley of Winchester, so as to prevent him from joining BEAUREGARD.
